t: Job 15
Then*p answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
Should*p a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
Should*p he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
Yea,*p thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
For*p thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
Thine*p own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
Art*p thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
Hast*p thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
What*p knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
With*p us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
Are*p the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
Why*p doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
That*p thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
What*p is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
Behold,*p he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
How*p much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
I*p will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
Which*p wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
Unto*p whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
The*p wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
A*p dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
He*p believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
He*p wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Trouble*p and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
For*p he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
He*p runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
Because*p he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
And*p he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
He*p shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
He*p shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
Let*p not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
It*p shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
He*p shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
For*p the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
They*p conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
